alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:39PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kenedy, northern Cameron, and Willacy Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 238 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Rudolph to near San Perlita High School. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, Raymondville, Lyford, Rio Hondo, Arroyo City, Sebastian, Combes, San Perlita, Port Mansfield Airport, and Yznaga. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 31 and 51. US Highway 77 between mile markers 744 and 762. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
